Data Structures

class  SectionWindow

Detailed Description

Implements a singleton of a Desktop. The Desktop administrates a panel which can be used as a softkey bar or whatever. Panels are members of Application. A desktop may also have:
  • a glasspane, which may contain graphical objects staying above all windows (e. g. a battery-indicator or a mouse-pointer).
  • sections, which are aligned at the four borders of the desktop. Those sections may show e. g. some indicators.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Desktop::PanelAlignment
 

Enumerator:
PanelOnLeft 
PanelOnRight 
PanelOnTop 
PanelOnBottom 

enum Desktop::SectionAlignment
 

The section alignment describes how the sections on the borders are aligned.

Enumerator:
HorizBorderAlign  The top- and bottom-section use the whole width of the desktop. The left- and right-section use the remaining height.
VertBorderAlign  The left- and right-section use the whole height of the desktop. The top- and bottom-section use the remaining width.

enum Desktop::SectionType
 

The section type describes on which border of the desktop the section should be aligned.

Enumerator:
LeftSection 
TopSection 
RightSection 
BottomSection 
LastSectionEntry  Mandatory last entry.

Member Function Documentation

GlassPane * Desktop::CreateGlassPane (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Factory method for creating a glasspane. Overwrite this method to instantiate an own glasspane. Per default an instance of the class GlassPane is created.

Desktop * Desktop::CreateInstance (  PanelAlignment  panel_align = PanelOnBottom,
SectionAlignment  section_align = HorizBorderAlign
)  [static]
 

Creates an instance of the Desktop. Alignment of the panel, which is per default on the bottom. Alignment of the sections on the desktop-border.

Returns:
a pointer to the instance

Component * Desktop::CreateSection (  SectionType  section_type  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Factory method for creating a section. Overwrite this method to instantiate a section dependant from the section type. The desktop automatically will set the parent of the created section. Per default 0 is returned.

Rect Desktop::GetCenterBounds (   )  const
 

Returns:
The boundaries of the center of the desktop. If a center has been defined by Desktop::SetCenter, the boundaries of the section minus the gap for the borders is returned. Otherwise the section boundaries are returned (see Desktop::GetSectionContainerBounds).

GlassPane * Desktop::GetGlassPane (   ) 
 

Returns:
Pointer to the glasspane. Invokes the factory method Desktop::CreateGlassPane when GetGlassPane is invoked the first time.

static Desktop* Desktop::GetInstance (   )  [inline, static]
 

Get an instance of the Desktop.

Returns:
a pointer to the instance, or null if no such instance exists

PanelAlignment Desktop::GetPanelAlignment (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
the current panel alignment

Rect Desktop::GetPanelBounds (   )  const
 

Returns:
The boundaries of the panel. An empty rectangle is returned, if the panel is disabled.

Component * Desktop::GetSection (  SectionType  section_type  ) 
 

Returns:
Pointer to the section defined by the section type. Invokes the factory method Desktop::CreateSection when GetSection is invoked the first time.

Rect Desktop::GetSectionContainerBounds (   )  const
 

Returns:
The boundaries of the section container, which are different from the the boundaries of the display, as they exclude the panel (the panel is not part of the section container).

BOOLEAN Desktop::IsPanelEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE if the panel is enabled, FALSE otherwise

BOOLEAN Desktop::OnMessage (  const Message &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

See also:
Dispatcher::OnMessage

Implements Dispatcher.

void Desktop::Release (   ) 
 

Must be invoked by the application which created the Desktop by Desktop::CreateInstance.

void Desktop::SetCenter (  Window *  win,
XYDIM  left_gap = 0,
XYDIM  top_gap = 0,
XYDIM  right_gap = 0,
XYDIM  bottom_gap = 0
) 
 

Sets the window win as center of the desktop and opens it automatically. Usually win represents the idlescreen of an MMI. The gaps define the space in pixels for the sections on the borders of the desktop. The sections are created by the factory method Desktop::CreateSection.

void Desktop::SetPanelAlignment (  PanelAlignment  alignment  ) 
 

Sets the panel alignment and the panel properties corresponding to the alignment.

void Desktop::SetPanelEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enable  ) 
 

Sets whether the panel is enabled or not.
